--- In junit@y..., "Richard Bolen" <bolen@g...> wrote:
> I think this is a classloader problem but I'm not sure.  
> 
> I'm trying to test my app using junit.  My app is distributed and 
uses serialization to send java objects over the wire.  When I run my 
tests from within Forte they work fine.  When I run them from the 
command line I get a InvalidClassException stating the 
serialVersionUID of my class is 0, which doesn't match the receiving 
version ID of the class.  The id of 0 makes me think that for some 
reason my serialized classes aren't being loaded properly.  For one 
thing I'm defining the serialVersionUID myself and it's not 0.  
> 
> My application seems to work perfectly except for the class version 
problem so the classes are being loaded at least by the VM's default 
class loader (and it works from within forte!?).
> 

I'm guessing your computation of the serialVersionUID is based on all 
instance variables, not just the non-transient ones.

Mike
